definition:
A rent or long aperture; a chink; a fissure; a crack. Sir T. Browne.

White frost; hoarfrost; congealed dew or vapor. The trees were now covered with rime. De Quincey.

To freeze or congeal into hoarfrost.

A step or round of a ladder; a rung.

Rhyme. See Rhyme. Coleridge. Landor. Note: This spelling, which is etymologically preferable, is coming into use again.

To rhyme. See Rhyme.
